pullsbody:
Fixes #26


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: An experimental add-on to change how Firefox reader mode and narration are presented
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #26.

_(Message COC002)_

pull_commit_message: Add ESLint config and pretty up package.json

pulltitle: Send payloads for control group as well
pullsbody:
- Add "finished" stopReason to "narrate-playback" payload.
- Add "narrate-enter" payload to signal entering narrate mode.

- Add "finished" stopReason to "narrate-playback" payload.
- Add "narrate-enter" payload to signal entering narrate mode.

pull_commit_message:
Send payloads for control group as well.

- Add "finished" stopReason to "narrate-playback" payload.
- Add "narrate-enter" payload to signal entring narrate mode.

pull_repo_desc: An experimental add-on to change how Firefox reader mode and narration are presented
pull_commit_message:
Change reader button to listen button

TODO: Figure out how to make content scripts load for about:reader pages

pull_repo_desc: An experimental add-on to change how Firefox reader mode and narration are presented
pull_commit_message:
Overcome MatchPattern restriction using mozillaAddons permission.

We use experimental aboutScripts API that pretty much replicates native contentScripts API but skips check that throws https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/2ee9341d0149cc772c6d8a5a010733faa05c1c87/toolkit/components/extensions/parent/ext-contentScripts.js#L147

pull_repo_desc: An experimental add-on to change how Firefox reader mode and narration are presented
pull_commit_message:
Turns out we don't need aboutScripts

After talking to @rpl on IRC about the exception we worked around with aboutScripts he pointed out that contenScripts defined in manifest get added through diffecent code path and it turns out mozillaAddons permission was all we needed.

pull_repo_desc: An experimental add-on to change how Firefox reader mode and narration are presented
pull_commit_message: Commit all the changes.
